title.narrative: Resilience in: Obstetric Skills project - Health Partnership between RCOG (UK), Kitovu Hospital (Uganda) and Masaka Regional Referral Hospital (Uganda).

description.narrative: This project delivers training in essential obstetric skills for multi-disciplinary health care providers working in maternal health, including training of local trainers to increase teaching capacity. This project has the aim to improve management of obstetric patients, reduce emergencies and therefore poor outcomes for women and babies and increase the level of high-quality, respectful care received by women and girls.

activity-date.narrative: This is a one-year project from January 2018 - January 2019.

description.narrative: Funds transferred to Kitovu Hospital for all costs associated with running training courses there, including; room hire, refreshments, UK volunteer board and lodging, stipend and travel allowance for delegates, trainee fee, project manager fee.

receiver-org.narrative: KHCC is a private, Catholic mission hospital based outside of Masaka Town.

description.narrative: Funds transferred to cover all costs associated with running training courses at the hospital, including room hire, refreshments, travel, stipends, trainer fees, project management fees.

provider-org.narrative: UKAID funds transferred from RCOG to Masaka Hospital.

receiver-org.narrative: Masaka is a tertiary government hospital in Masaka Town.
